clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess Persistence, Adherence and Changes in Disease Activity in the Children Population of Juvenile Arthritis Patients Treated With Adalimumab (HUMIRA®)
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Multi-Center Observational Study to Assess Persistence, Adherence and Changes in Disease Activity in the Children Population of Juvenile Arthritis Patients Treated With Adalimumab (HUMIRA®) in the Routine Clinical Settings in the Russian Federation

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to assess persistence, adherence and changes in disease activity in the children population of juvenile arthritis patients treated with adalimumab (HUMIRA®) in the routine clinical settings in the Russian Federation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose of the study drug (approximately 52 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Persistence is defined as the time (in days) between the start date of HUMIRA (adalimumab) treatment and the earliest date of discontinuation of Humira (adalimumab) or drop out of study, or lost to follow up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with Humira adherence
secondary_outcome.description: The adherence to Humira will be assessed

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with 30% American College of Rheumatology (ACR) pediatric responses
secondary_outcome.description: It is defined as 30% improvement respectively in a minimum of three core set criteria with worsening of one variable by no more than 30%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with 50% American College of Rheumatology (ACR) pediatric responses
secondary_outcome.description: It is defined as 50% improvement respectively in a minimum of three core set criteria with worsening of one variable by no more than 30%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with 70% American College of Rheumatology (ACR) pediatric responses
secondary_outcome.description: It is defined as 70% improvement respectively in a minimum of three core set criteria with worsening of one variable by no more than 30%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in physician overall disease activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 48 of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: This is measured using Visual Analog Scale (VAS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in patient (if appropriate in age) or parent overall well-being
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 48 of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: This is measured using Visual Analog Scale (VAS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index (CHAQ-DI) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 weeks of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index (CHAQ-DI) score is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in number of joints with active arthritis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 48 of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The change in number of joints with active arthritis is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in number of joints with limited range of motion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 48 of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The change in number of joints with limited range of motion is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 48 of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in 10-joint Juvenile Arthritis Disease Activity Score (JADAS10)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 48 of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: 10-joint Juvenile Arthritis Disease Activity Score is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patient with low diseases activity (1.1 - 2 score)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 weeks of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: This is assessed based on JADAS10 score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patient with moderate disease activity (2.1 - 4.2 score)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 weeks of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: This is assessed based on JADAS10 score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with missed dosed of HUMIRA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 weeks of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with missed dosed of HUMIRA is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with predefined Extra-articular manifestations (EAMs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 weeks of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with predefined EAMs is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with any comorbidity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 weeks of the treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with any comorbidities are assessed.

arm_group.description: Children with diagnosed polyarticular juvenile arthritis according to International League of Associations for Rheumatology (ILAR) criteria treated with HUMIRA (adalimumab) in the routine clinical settings in the Russian Federation

study_pop.textblock: Children with diagnosed polyarticular juvenile arthritis according to ILAR criteria treated with HUMIRA (adalimumab) in routine clinical settings in the Russian Federation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis of polyarticular Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis (JIA) according to International League of Associations for Rheumatology (ILAR) criteria .
- Planned treatment with HUMIRA according to the local product label and prescription guidelines. Alternatively, subjects assigned to HUMIRA treatment not more than 1 month prior to inclusion can be enrolled.
- Negative result of tuberculosis (TB) screening procedure and TB specialist permission to start biologic therapy.
- Patient's informed consent form signed by the parent or guardian/and by the child, if applicable.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has contraindications for the treatment with HUMIRA according to the latest version of the locally approved label.
- Any biologic drugs taken prior to 3 months of enrolment in the study.
- Patients treated with any biosimilar version of HUMIRA
- Previous participation and dropout from this study.
- Patients participating in another clinical and/or observational study priory 3 months before the enrolment to this study.
